main event: An unidentified circular object was observed flying in Danbury, Connecticut on August 11, 1960.
interesting points: The object was detected by radar traveling at high speed and was confirmed by visual observation from a nearby location,It was described as round and glowing, with a pinkish-orange color,The object reached an altitude of approximately 35,000 feet,There was a suggestion that the observation could be attributed to ball lightning, but doubts remain concerning the nature of the observation,The witness reported that the object disappeared suddenly after fading from view.
witness description: The witness was with their son when they observed the object moving across the sky.
